page.title: 14The Bellhouse.
page.content: { The Bellhouse}is the most interesting building in Eastwood village. It was originally a{16th Century hunting {lodge}and is named after the huge bell that once rang out to tell the wild boar hunters where they could find shelter. By 1770, it was in use as a farmhouse. Part of the inventory at the time of its sale to the Cornish family in 1903 tells of a very good farmhouse,barn,stables,farmyard,ponds, garden and livestock. The farm became the centre of the Cornish brickworks for the next 60 years. Today, the Bell house is a{Falstaff Tavern.}Mr.Silk, the present manager, has been studying its history and many of the old farm implements now decorate the walls of the pub.,with the great bell standing in one corner.
